alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 8:19PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherokee and southeastern Polk Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 819 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ducktown, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murphy, Ducktown, William L. Davenport Refuge, Copperhill, Culberson and Hot House. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern North Carolina...and east Tennessee.
